title: Brown Shooting and an M.I.T. Professor’s Killing: What We Know
summary: A single suspect carried out the shooting at Brown University and the killing of an M.I.T. professor, and was later found dead in New Hampshire, authorities said.

title: Suspect in MIT Professor’s Death Was an Ex-Classmate from Portugal, Prosecutors Say
summary: Nuno F.G. Loureiro, the professor, attended the same physics program in Portugal as the man suspected in his killing.

title: A Reddit Post Led to a Breakthrough in the Brown Shooting Investigation
summary: A Reddit user provided information that helped identify Claudio Manuel Neves Valente as not only the suspect in the campus shooting, but also the murder of an M.I.T. professor.

title: Brown University Shooting Suspect Found Dead, and Trump Eases Marijuana Restrictions
summary: Plus, your Friday news quiz.

title: Europe to Lend $105 Billion to Ukraine, Without Touching Russian Funds
summary: European Union officials wanted to use Russia’s frozen assets to back a major loan to Ukraine. Facing opposition in their own camp, they settled on another way.

title: With New E.U. Loan, Ukraine Avoids Budget Crunch and Can Plan War Effort
summary: The loan will cover two-thirds of the country’s financial needs for the next two years. It also bolsters Ukraine’s position in ongoing peace talks.

title: Putin Reaffirms Broad Military Goals for Russia in Ukraine
summary: President Vladimir V. Putin spoke at an annual news conference that highlights his grip over Russia and often sets the Kremlin’s tone for the next year.

title: ‘A Singularly Turbulent Time’: Deeper Uncertainty in Store for Global Economy
summary: A reordering of the rules of trade, set on top of transformational change in technology, demographics and climate, is remaking jobs, politics and lives.

title: Bank of Japan Raises Interest Rates to Highest Level in 30 Years
summary: The Bank of Japan moved to slow inflation as the prime minister is borrowing more to fund an ambitious effort to build up industry and support households.

title: Want to Know Where the Market Is Going? Don’t Trust This, or Any, Forecast.
summary: Wall Street stock gurus are making predictions again. Our columnist got into the game with a number he doesn’t believe.

title: How the Army Caused Alarm in the Washington Skies Years Before a Fatal Crash
summary: An aged helicopter fleet and inexperienced pilots from nearby Fort Belvoir had raised “widespread concern” among local pilots before a midair collision killed 67 people.

title: Judge Convicted of Obstructing Agents as They Sought Undocumented Immigrant
summary: The Wisconsin state judge, Hannah C. Dugan, was accused of ushering a man to a side door as federal agents waited outside a courtroom.

title: Takeaways From the Trial of Wisconsin Judge Hannah Dugan
summary: The Milwaukee judge was charged with obstructing federal immigration agents, who were trying to arrest a man who had appeared before her on a battery charge.

title: Trump’s Attacks on Rob Reiner and Others Characterize an Uninhibited 2nd Term
summary: Many of President Trump’s supporters love his professional-wrestling style of leadership. But some of his recent attacks have sickened even some of his own political allies.

title: Trump Administration to Appeal Harvard Funding Case
summary: Facing a deadline to appeal, the Justice Department told the courts late Thursday that it would try to overturn a judge’s ruling in favor of Harvard.

title: Trump Signs Law Repealing Tough Sanctions on Syria
summary: The Caesar Act was imposed in 2019 in response to widespread and systematic violations of human rights by the regime of former dictator Bashar al-Assad.

title: Florida Executed A Record 19 People in 2025. He Witnessed Them All.
summary: John Koch, a radio reporter, witnesses every execution in Florida to keep close tabs on what he considers one of the most consequential actions the state takes.

title: Falling Enrollment, Money Woes: The New School Seeks a Path to Survival
summary: The New York City university has embarked on an overhaul that some professors and students say imperils its standing as a bastion of the liberal arts.

title: After the Louvre Heist, Museums Look for Lessons to Help Stop Thieves
summary: Museums and the consultants who advise them have been busy reviewing their own precautions in the aftermath of the brazen daylight break-in at the Louvre.

title: U.S. Will Pay $450,000 to Wildfire Fighters With Cancer
summary: They will be eligible for a one-time payment as well as college tuition for their children. The effort is part of a legislative push to address the dangers of working in toxic smoke.

title: Mitt Romney: Tax the Rich, Like Me
summary: There’s no getting around this if we want to avoid the deficit cliff ahead.

title: Trump’s New Marijuana Policy Offers an Opportunity
summary: Marijuana has been tied to psychosis and other health problems. I still think it’s safer than alcohol.

title: Britain Is Preparing for Attacks on Its Soil. Critics Say It Must Move Faster.
summary: As military officials sound the alarm over Russian hybrid attacks, the chair of Parliament’s defense committee said the government’s progress on ramping up home defense was “glacial.”

title: Mamdani Appointee Resigns After Decade-Old Antisemitic Posts Re-emerge
summary: Catherine Almonte Da Costa resigned from her just-announced post as Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani’s director of appointments after the Anti-Defamation League resurfaced the comments.

title: NASA Webb Telescope Discovers Lemon-Shaped Planet, the ‘Stretchiest’ Ever Seen
summary: An unusual object orbiting a rapidly spinning star might be a new phenomenon in the universe.
